description: figure seated in dhyanasana with hands in lap; cushion below figure carved with foliate sprays and central quatrefoil medallion; crest ornamented with a diamond-shaped srivatsa; back uncarved
inscription:
Carved inscription:

\"This image was caused to be made in samvat 1165 in the dark half of the month Jyestha, 5th day, a Wednesday, by Jaluka, son of Avasara ?, in the poravata lineage from which the poet Malli Kavi came.\"

Translation by Phyllis Granoff via email, 4/23/2014
markings: inscription on cushion at top; dealer\'s sticker, at proper left shoulderblade
text: Stone sculptures like this one represent models of perfection achieved through intense spiritual discipline and devotion. This seated meditative figure is a Jina, or “victor,” a liberated being whose renunciation of passion and anger is intended as a guide for others. The highly polished surface is a metaphor for his absolute purity.
title: Seated Jina
